name:
WARNING: please check you have started this container with a volume that is mounted to /data
 otherwise any flow changes are lost when you redeploy or upgrade the container
 (e.g. upgrade to a more recent node-red docker image).
  If you are using named volumes you can ignore this warning.
 Double click or see info side panel to learn how to start Node-RED in Docker to save your work
info:
To start docker with a bind mount volume (-v option), for example:

```
docker run -it -p 1880:1880 -v /home/user/node_red_data:/data --name mynodered nodered/node-red
```

where `/home/user/node_red_data` is a directory on your host machine where you want to store your flows.

If you do not do this then you can experiment and redploy flows, but if you restart or upgrade the container the flows will be disconnected and lost. 

They will still exist in a hidden data volume, which can be recovered using standard docker techniques, but that is much more complex than just starting with a named volume as described above.

<md-button style="display:inline-block" ng-repeat="(key, value) in msg.payload"
    ng-click="send({payload: value.number})">{{value.name}}</md-button>

name: Access function
func:
#deve vedere se il nome inserito  nella lista utenti
subbed_users=msg['payload']
pot_user=msg['user']
pot_user_name=pot_user['usr']
pot_user_pwd=pot_user['pwd']
result=0

for user in subbed_users:
    username=user['userId']
    
    
    if username==pot_user_name:
        password=user['password']
        if password == pot_user_pwd:
            result=1
            msg['payload']={'username':pot_user_name,'plants':user['plants']}
        break

    
msg['result']=result



return msg

name: Register function
User found mess
func:
user=msg['payload']['username']
msg['payload']=f"Welcome to Rootypy {user}"
return msg

name: User not found mess
func:
msg['payload']=f"Username or password NOT found:\nPlease try again"
return msg

name: Change tab to user tab
Hide login/show register
Request subscription
func:
username=msg['payload']['userId']
password=msg['payload']['password']

msg['payload']={ 'userId': username, 'password': password,"chatID":None}
return msg

name: Mess complete registration
func:
msg['payload']=f"Registration complete"
return msg

name: Change tab to user tab
Mess user name already present
func:
msg['payload']=f"Username was already taken. Please try with a different name"
return msg

name: Fetch current user
func:
msg.user = flow.get("user");
return msg;

name: Exit page
Show first
func:
import json

option=msg['options']
user=msg['user']
if len(option)>0:
    first_option=option[0]
    msg['text']=first_option
    #for measurament in possMeasures:
    #richiedo l'umidit per ora
    msg['choice']=first_option
    #msg['url']=f"http://192.68.0.25:8080/getData/{user}/{first_option}?measurament=humidity&duration=1"
else:
    msg['choice']=""
return msg

name: Choice manager
func:
import json
choice=msg['payload']
msg['text']=choice
msg['choice']=choice
return msg

name: Read tanklvl
func:
msg['payload']=15
return msg

name: Read users plants
func:
import json
user=msg['user']
plants=msg["payload"]
 #palce holder
#importante dire options se no non capisce
msg['options']=[]
msg['plants']=[]
for plant in plants:
    ID=plant['plantId']
    CODE=plant['plantCode']
    if plant['userId']==user:
        msg['options'].append(ID)
        msg['plants'].append(plant)
    

return msg

name: Url measure humidity
func:
possMeasures=msg['possMeasures']
user=msg['user']
choice=msg['choice']
msg['url']=f"http://192.68.0.25:8080/getData/{user}/{choice}?measurament={possMeasures[0]}&duration=1"
return msg

name: Url measure  "tankLvl"
func:
user=msg['user']
choice=msg['choice']
measure= "tankLvl"
msg['url']=f"http://192.68.0.25:8080/getData/{user}/{choice}?measurament={measure}&duration=1"
return msg

name: Go to registration form
Go to registration form
Retrive selected plant info
Find current plant devices
func:
online_dev=msg['payload']
sel_plant=msg['selected_plant']
current_plant_online_dev=[]
for dev in online_dev:
    plant_code,dev_type = dev['deviceID'].split('/')
    if plant_code==sel_plant['plantCode']:
        current_plant_online_dev.append(dev_type)


msg["current_plant_online_dev"]=current_plant_online_dev
return msg

name: Fetch new plant info
Plant sub res
func:
response=msg['payload']
sub_status=response['status']

if sub_status == "OK":
    result=1
    msg['payload']="Plant was added to list"
    
else:
    result=0
    msg['payload']="Could not add plant to list. Try again"
msg['result']=result
return msg

Read users plants
func:
import json
user=msg['user']
plants=msg["plants"]
 #palce holder
#importante dire options se no non capisce
msg['options']=[]
for plant in plants:
    msg['options'].append(plant['plantId'])
    

return msg

name: 1 Dialog delete plant
func:
msg['plant_to_delete']=msg['payload']
msg['payload']="You have selected a plant to delete. Do you want to continue?"
return msg

name: 2 Dialog delete account
func:
msg['payload']="This will imply the deletion of your plant infomation in Rootypy. Do you uderstand?"
return msg

name: Fetch user
func:
msg.user = global.get("user")
return msg;

name: Produce deletion url
func:
user=msg['user']
plantId=msg['plant_to_delete']
msg['url']=f"http://192.68.0.25:8080/rmp/{user}/{plantId}"
return msg

name: Deletion result
func:
response=msg['payload']
deletion_status=response['status']
if deletion_status == "OK":
    result=1
    msg['payload']="Plant deletion was successful"
    
else:
    result=0
    msg['payload']="Deletion refused, please try again"
msg['result']=result
return msg

name: Fetch current user
func:
msg.user = global.get("user");
return msg;

name: refresh_plant_list
func:
#deve vedere se il nome inserito  nella lista utenti
subbed_users=msg['payload']
curr_user=msg['user']

result=0

for user in subbed_users:
    username=user['userId']
    if username==curr_user:
        msg['payload']=user['plants']
        break

    
return msg

return msg;

name: Set old time
func:
msg['start_time']=msg['payload']['start_time']
msg['end_time']=msg['payload']['end_time']
return msg

name: Body creator
func:
msg['payload']={
    "user":msg['user'],
    "plant":msg['plantId'],
    "start_time":f"{round(msg['start']/3600000)}:00",
    "end_time":f"{round(msg['end']/3600000)}:00"
}
return msg

func:

msg["topic"]="RootyPy/node_red"
msg["payload"]={"bn":"updateCatalogService","e":[{"n": "node_red", "t": time.time(), "v":None,"u":"IP"}]}
return msg

where `/home/user/node_red_data` is a directory on your host machine where you want to store your flows.

If you do not do this then you can experiment and redploy flows, but if you restart or upgrade the container the flows will be disconnected and lost. 

They will still exist in a hidden data volume, which can be recovered using standard docker techniques, but that is much more complex than just starting with a named volume as described above.
